- Added a README for the Supermarket API, outlining changes, frameworks used, and testing instructions.

Implement intelligent cache invalidation based on repository push dates

Major Performance Improvements:
- Add push_date-aware caching for commits, languages, and README
- Only re-fetch data when repository is actually updated
- Different granularity for different data types:
  * Commit stats: Daily (invalidates on any push)
  * Languages: Weekly (code changes less frequently)
  * README: Monthly (docs rarely change)
  * AI summaries: Weekly (already implemented)

Cache Strategy:
- Unchanged repos: 100% cache hit (zero API calls)
- Active repos: Only new commits fetched
- Stale repos: Longer cache retention

Expected Performance:
- First run: ~5-7 minutes (cold cache)
- Weekly run (few updates): <2 minutes (90%+ cache hits)
- Daily run (unchanged): <1 minute (100% cache hits)

Changes:
- fetcher.py: Add repo_pushed_at parameter to caching methods
- unified_data_generator.py: Pass push dates to all fetch calls
- unified_report_workflow.py: Pass push dates for README/languages
- cli.py: Pass push dates in analyze command
- config/spark.yml: Document smart cache strategy
- workflow: Enhanced cache status reporting with visual separators

This addresses the core issue: only ~5-10 repos update weekly,
but we were re-fetching all 50+ repos every time.

Optimize caching for faster workflow execution

- Change AI summary cache from daily to weekly granularity (reduces churn by 7x)
- Add cache status logging in workflow for visibility
- Initialize cache with config TTL (6 hours) instead of hardcoded 30 days
- Add cache diagnostics step to show cache size and file count

Performance improvements:
- Weekly cache keys prevent unnecessary AI regeneration every day
- Config-driven TTL respects constitutional 6-hour requirement
- Cache logging helps diagnose future performance issues

Expected: Workflow should be <2 minutes on cached runs (was 7 minutes)

Fix GitHub Actions build: Handle frontend/public/data symlink properly

- Remove tracked Windows file that breaks Linux builds
- Add workflow step to create symlink before build
- Add explicit data copy step after build
- Configure Vite to handle missing symlink gracefully
- Add frontend/public/data to .gitignore
- Document setup in frontend/public/README.md

Fixes: ENOENT error when Vite tries to copy public/data directory

feat: Complete mobile-first redesign implementation

Reorganize documentation into domain-specific folders

Improved documentation organization for better discoverability and maintenance.

## Changes

### New Documentation Structure
- `/docs/guides/` - User guides and tutorials
  - getting-started.md
  - analyze-command.md
  - configuration.md
  - embedding-guide.md
- `/docs/api/` - API reference documentation
  - api-reference.md
- `/docs/research/` - Research documents
  - RESEARCH_RECOMMENDATIONS.md
  - TECH_STACK_CURRENCY_RESEARCH.md
- `/docs/development/` - Development documentation
  - ENHANCEMENT_FUN_STATS.md
  - IMPLEMENTATION_COMPLETE.md
  - IMPLEMENTATION_SUMMARY.md
- `/docs/specs/` - Feature specifications (moved from /specs)
  - 001-ai-repo-summary/
  - 001-stats-spark/
- `/docs/CHANGELOG.md` - Version history (moved from root)
- `/docs/README.md` - Documentation index and navigation

### Files Moved
- Moved all markdown files from root to `/docs` (except README.md)
- Moved `/specs` folder to `/docs/specs`
- Organized existing docs into domain-specific subfolders

### Updated References
- Updated all documentation links in README.md
- Updated cross-references in guide documents
- Added comprehensive documentation index at `/docs/README.md`

### Result
- ✅ Only README.md remains at repository root
- ✅ All documentation centralized under `/docs`
- ✅ Clear domain separation for easier navigation
- ✅ Maintained all existing documentation content
- ✅ Updated all internal links to reflect new structure

Merge feature: AI-Powered Repository Analysis (v2.0.0)

Merges feature branch 001-ai-repo-summary into main.

This major release adds comprehensive AI-powered repository analysis
capabilities with intelligent ranking, dependency currency assessment,
and rich statistics.

Key Features:
- AI-powered repository summaries with Claude Haiku
- Multi-ecosystem dependency analysis (NPM, PyPI, RubyGems, Go, Maven, NuGet)
- Intelligent composite ranking algorithm
- Enhanced statistics: contributors, quality indicators, releases
- .NET/NuGet support with .csproj parsing
- Comprehensive CLI (spark analyze command)
- Full documentation and test coverage

See CHANGELOG.md for complete feature list.

🤖 Generated with [Claude Code](https://claude.com/claude-code)

Co-Authored-By: Claude Sonnet 4.5 <noreply@anthropic.com>

Complete AI-Powered Repository Analysis feature (v2.0.0)

This commit completes the implementation of the AI-Powered GitHub Repository
Summary Report feature, adding comprehensive repository analysis capabilities.

## Core Features Implemented

### Repository Analysis Command (spark analyze)
- Intelligent ranking algorithm (30% popularity, 45% activity, 25% health)
- AI-powered summaries via Anthropic Claude Haiku
- Three-tier fallback strategy (AI → Enhanced template → Basic template)
- Multi-window activity analysis (90d/180d/365d)
- Composite scoring for repository ranking

### Data Models
- Repository, CommitHistory, TechnologyStack models
- RepositorySummary with AI and fallback support
- UserProfile for developer analysis
- Report model for complete analysis output

### Dependency Analysis
- Multi-ecosystem support: NPM, PyPI, RubyGems, Go, Maven, NuGet
- .NET/NuGet support with .csproj parsing
- Version currency assessment with semantic versioning
- 7-day cache TTL with hybrid caching strategy

### Enhanced Statistics
- .NET SDK version detection from TargetFramework
- "Days ago" formatting for dates (created, pushed, releases)
- **Tier 1**: Contributors count, repository size, language count
- **Quality Focus**: CI/CD detection, tests, LICENSE, documentation
- **Activity Focus**: Release count, latest release date, commit velocity

### CLI Enhancements
- spark analyze --user <username>
- --list-only for dry-run preview
- --top-n for custom repository count
- --output for custom directory
- Progress indicators and graceful error handling

### Documentation
- Comprehensive docs/analyze-command.md (450+ lines)
- Updated getting-started.md with API key setup
- CHANGELOG.md with version 2.0.0 announcement
- Sample report in output/reports/

### Testing
- 17+ integration tests covering all user stories
- Unit tests for ranking, parsing, version checking
- Edge case validation and performance testing

## Files Changed
- Created: CHANGELOG.md, docs/analyze-command.md
- Created: src/spark/dependencies/ (analyzer, parser, version_checker)
- Created: 7 test files (integration + unit)
- Modified: Repository model with 9 new fields
- Modified: CLI with dependency analysis integration
- Modified: ReportGenerator with enhanced output
- Modified: setup.py (version 2.0.0)
- Modified: config/spark.yml (analyzer section, nuget support)

## Constitution Compliance
✅ Python-First: All modules independently importable
✅ CLI Interface: Full CLI access for local testing
✅ Data Privacy: Explicit public-only repository filter
✅ Testability: Comprehensive test coverage
✅ Observable: Progress tracking and detailed logging
✅ Performance: <3-minute target for 50 repositories
✅ Configuration: YAML-based with env overrides

feat: implement speckit command suite for project constitution, implementation, planning, specification, task generation, and issue conversion

feat: Complete specification analysis and remediation for Stats Spark

Complete cross-artifact analysis and resolution of all 16 identified issues across spec.md, plan.md, and tasks.md. Project now fully aligned with constitution and ready for implementation.

## Analysis Summary
- Analyzed 3 core artifacts (spec.md, plan.md, tasks.md) against constitution
- Identified and resolved 16 findings across all severity levels
- 1 CRITICAL, 4 HIGH, 8 MEDIUM, 3 LOW severity issues fixed
- Added 10 new tasks for test coverage and validation (117 → 127 tasks)

## Critical Fixes (Constitution Alignment)
- Updated plan.md constitution check to acknowledge existing constitution.md
- Added full alignment verification against all 5 constitution principles
- Restructured test tasks to pair with implementation (T058b-e, T065a, T109-T114, T118)
- Meets constitution Principle IV >80% test coverage requirement

## Specification Improvements (spec.md)
- FR-007: Added detailed Spark Score normalization methodology
- FR-013: Specified exponential backoff retry logic (1s, 2s, 4s, 8s)
- FR-015: Added concrete error message examples
- FR-017: Defined Lightning Round Stats format (max 80 chars, pattern)
- FR-028: New requirement for deleted/private repository handling
- SC-001: Clarified target audience (developers familiar with GitHub Actions)
- SC-005: Added programmatic WCAG validation requirement (4.5:1 contrast)
- Edge cases: Removed duplication, now reference functional requirements

## Plan Improvements (plan.md)
- Updated summary to use consistent "markhazleton account" terminology
- Fixed constitution check status from "not defined" to "exists and verified"
- Corrected config schema to match spec's 5 output categories
- Added constitution compliance verification for all 5 principles

## Task Improvements (tasks.md)
- Added T058a: Deleted/private repository handling (FR-028)
- Added T058b-e: Unit tests for StatsCalculator and StatisticsVisualizer
- Added T065a: WCAG contrast validation unit tests
- Enhanced T109-T114: Improved test specifications with acceptance criteria
- Added T118: Explicit >80% coverage verification task
- Updated task counts and parallel opportunities
- Added constitution compliance note

## Infrastructure
- Created comprehensive .gitignore for Python project
- Blocks API cache (.cache/), tokens (secrets/), credentials
- Keeps example SVGs in assets/examples/ for documentation
- Security-focused: prevents accidental token/credential commits
- Cross-platform support (macOS, Windows, Linux)

## Coverage Metrics
- Requirements with tasks: 28/28 (100%)
- Success criteria with validation: 9/11 (81.8%)
- Constitution alignment: 5/5 principles (100%)
- Total tasks: 127 (includes test coverage)
